question: Which country houses the Cockscomb Basin Wildlife Sanctuary, the world's first and only jaguar reserve?
explanation: Cockscomb Basin Wildlife Sanctuary is the first jaguar reserve in the world. It is located in Belize. It lies on the eastern slopes of Maya Mountains. It was established in 1986 as the first protected area for the protection of Jaguar (Panthera onca). This sanctuary is home to all five of Belize cats- Jaguar, Puma, Margay, Jaguarundi, Ocelot.
